description: Smallest difference between consecutive divisors (ordered by size) of 2n+1.
comments: Successively greater values of a(n) occur when 2n+1 is prime.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n=38, 2n+1=77; divisors={1,7,11,77}; differences={6,4,66}; a(38) = smallest difference = 4.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 19 2001
